image.altText: A woman in black walks quickly past a camera, accompanied by another woman in black holding files.

props.synopsis: A former Canberra student teacher convicted by a jury of sexual offences against a 15-year-old boy she first met on a teaching practical has been spared jail.

title.children: Former student teacher avoids jail for sexual offences against teen

image.altText: A can of Coca-Cola with a plus one dollar label on it and two cans of Jim Beam with plus two dollar labels on it.

props.synopsis: When Ukraine's president faced a fiery meeting with Donald Trump at the White House, his plight struck a chord with a couple 16,000 kilometres away in rural Australia.

title.children: Yass Valley cafe imposes US drink tax over Trump's 'schoolyard bullying'

image.altText: A digital sign that says "London Circuit Closure 12 March" on the side of the road.

props.synopsis: The eastern side of London Circuit closed last night until late 2026 to allow for light rail construction and footpath improvements, but the businesses affected are feeling positive about the construction "because we'll have a far more modernised area to work from".

title.children: Business owners optimistic as another section of London Circuit closes

image.altText: A mosquito sucks blood from someone's forearm.

props.synopsis: An ACT man in his 70s has died after contracting the mosquito-borne virus following his holiday in the Murrumbidgee region.

title.children: Second NSW death from Japanese encephalitis after ACT visitor dies

image.altText: A concrete building with lettering above the entrance reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory".

props.synopsis: A Canberra man who made violent threats and sent images of bullets and what looked like a pipe bomb to his ex-wife, is allowed to serve his sentence in the community.

title.children: Canberra man who sent ex-wife violent threats allowed to walk free

image.altText: Jacinta Klein

props.synopsis: About 100 undergraduate and Masters teaching students in the ACT are in classrooms without supervision, in a program designed to help with the chronic teacher shortage. But does putting them in the classrooms earlier lead to burn out faster?

title.children: 'There was something missing': The students already teaching

image.altText: A photo which shows Gove refinery from the air. Gove Operations is located on the Gove Peninsula in North East Arnhem land.

props.synopsis: The Commonwealth has lost a High Court battle over whether it should be liable for compensation for lost or impaired native title rights over a mining lease on the Gove Peninsula in North East Arnhem Land.

title.children: Commonwealth loses High Court battle in native title compensation claim over Gove Peninsula

image.altText: The exterior of a restaurant with a sign reading "Zaab".

props.synopsis: The woman, now aged 54, told the Supreme Court the stairs were poorly lit and alleged the restaurant was negligent by failing to repair the uneven surface.

title.children: Woman awarded $284K in damages after falling at Braddon restaurant

image.altText: Paul laughs while sitting in a chair, wearing a blue shirt, glasses and lanyard hanging around his neck.

props.synopsis: The head of orthopaedic surgery at Canberrra Hospital resigns, along with several other surgeons, citing concerns over operational decisions being made by Canberra Health Services.

title.children: Canberra orthopaedic surgeons resign citing operational concerns

image.altText: A house is advertised for auction in the south-west Sydney suburb of Punchbowl.

props.synopsis: New data shows how Australia's housing market was impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic, with the most significant factor being how housing values changed.

title.children: These charts show Australia’s post-pandemic property price roller-coaster

image.altText: Dylan Moore celebrates a goal for the Hawks against the Bombers.

props.synopsis: Hawthorn makes it two wins to start the season after prevailing by 26 points against Essendon at the MCG in an entertaining Friday night clash.

title.children: Hawks stay unbeaten after 'ugly win' over spirited Bombers

image.altText: Sandon Smith celebrates

props.synopsis: The Roosters have stunned the Panthers 38-32 despite a late sin binning handing Penrith a lifeline in the final five minutes. Earlier, Manly lost Daly Cherry-Evans and Tom Trbojevic to injury as the Warriors upset the form guide in Auckland.

title.children: Star players injured as Roosters, Warriors claim upset wins

image.altText: English Formula 1 driver Oliver Bearman crahses into the wall

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri's hopes of being the first Australian in 45 years to win his home grand prix have not been soured after the opening day of the Australian Grand Prix weekend.

title.children: English rookie wrecks car in crash, McLaren and Ferrari set the pace

image.altText: A large brown and grey mound

props.synopsis: A 30-tonne congealed mass of items that should not be flushed, including wet wipes, sanitary products, oils and grease was removed by an excavator over two days.

title.children: 'Putrid' 30 tonne fatberg pulled from Perth's sewers

image.altText: Anthony Albanese press conference

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese will join a phone hook-up tomorrow night to discuss a possible joint peacekeeping force for Ukraine.

title.children: Albanese to join Ukraine 'coalition of the willing' peacekeeping call

image.altText: Powerlines suspended between towers against orange dusk sky.

props.synopsis: Federal Energy Minister Chris Bowen was joined by three energy ministers asking the regulator to reconsider its latest market pricing default in light of cost of living pressures.

title.children: Governments push back on planned power price hikes

image.altText: A photo of Gene Hackman

props.synopsis: Experts say the courts would "infringe on transparency" if records into the 95-year-old actor's death were not released.

title.children: Gene Hackman's estate seeks to block release of death investigation records

image.altText: Sam Landsberger looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: The driver will have his licence suspended for two and a half years after refusing a blood test, following a crash that killed sports journalist Sam Landsberger.

title.children: Driver sentenced over drug test refusal in crash that killed Melbourne journalist

image.altText: nsw police hold onto the arms of a handcuff man wearing shorts and no top as they escort him into a car

props.synopsis: Officers investigating reports of a missing man found what they suspect is a body in a paddock about 200 metres from a Glenorie house in Sydney's north-west.

title.children: Three arrested after suspected human remains found in Sydney paddock

image.altText: A container ship smouldering at sea, with charred shipping containers on board.

props.synopsis: New video shows the moment a cargo ship ploughed into a fuel tanker hired by the US military in the North Sea off England's east coast, as experts tell the ABC there is no evidence the ship's captain tried to take evasive action.

title.children: Video shows cargo ship hitting US military fuel tanker in North Sea

image.altText: A close-up view of a phone charging on a power bank

props.synopsis: Singapore Airlines has become the latest international airline to ban the use of portable power banks while onboard its flights.

title.children: The rules for power banks on flights are changing. Here's what to know

image.altText: Chinese flag with cattle

props.synopsis: Hundreds of abattoirs in the United States are at risk of being banned from exporting meat to China, because their export licences are due to expire this weekend.

title.children: US meat trade days away from getting 'kicked out' of China

image.altText: A flooded road.

props.synopsis: Homes and businesses flooded as the WA city of Albany received its highest rain total since records began in 1887.

title.children: Record-breaking wettest day causes flash flooding in southern WA

image.altText: passengers standing on the wing of a plane with smoke

props.synopsis: The plane caught fire after a safe landing at Denver International Airport, forcing the evacuation of passengers using the plane's slides.

title.children: Passengers evacuate onto wing after jet catches fire following safe landing in Denver

image.altText: A young female racing driver leaning on her car, holding her helmet, looking in the distance

props.synopsis: As one of the two inaugural Aussies on the grid in the all-female racing category, Aiva Anagnostiadis wants to be an example for other young girls who dream of driving fast.

title.children: Aiva only has a learner licence, but is inspiring young girls to go fast

image.altText: Man in police outfit standing in front of a table and banner in the background.

props.synopsis: An Indonesian police chief has been arrested after the Australian Federal Police traced child abuse material to the province of East Nusa Tenggara.

title.children: Indonesian cop arrested after AFP tip-off over alleged child abuse material

image.altText: Woman in black shirt with rocky background

props.synopsis: Rebecca Spies has addressed rumours circulating in western Queensland communities in relation to the disappearance of Tayla Spies, her sister and a Roma mother of three.

title.children: Tayla Spies' sister addresses rumours of her disappearance

image.altText: Protesters hold up signs

props.synopsis: US District Judge William Alsup said he was appalled employees were told they were being fired for poor performance despite receiving glowing evaluations just months earlier.

title.children: US judge orders Trump administration rehire thousands of sacked workers

image.altText: Two plastic containers with coloured tablets inside, held in the palms of a man's hands.

props.synopsis: Fiji health authorities are scrambling to stem an outbreak of HIV, as growing meth use and alarming needle-sharing trends accelerate the spread of the virus.

title.children: 'Bluetoothing': The shocking new trend fuelling HIV in Fiji

image.altText: person with parachute jumping off tall sand dune

props.synopsis: Travel plans have been thrown into turmoil after ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred left a trail of destruction prompting pleas from tourism operators for holiday-makers not to cancel their Easter getaways.

title.children: Families urged to stick with beach plans despite mass erosion from ex-Cyclone Alfred

image.altText: Trump and Musk look out the open driver's side door of a red Tesla

props.synopsis: Test yourself with this week's quiz.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Trump's new car, stranded astronauts and crocs eating pigs

image.altText: A shadowed figure behind a fence

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's prison population has reached a new high following its largest quarterly increase on record, cementing it as Australia's most incarcerated jurisdiction.

title.children: If the NT was a nation, its prison rate would trail only El Salvador

image.altText: A police officer and police vehicles on a suburban street beneath a sunny sky.

props.synopsis: The 19-year-old's lawyer told a WA court that his client had tried to be the voice of reason in the lead-up to the incident.

title.children: Teen accused of cutting off dad's arm with samurai sword granted bail

image.altText: Man sitting in the back of a police wagon surrounded by police.

props.synopsis: Alleged high-ranking Sydney members of the Finks outlaw motorcycle gang have been charged with what police describe as a targeted attack on a home south of Newcastle.

title.children: Five alleged bikies charged after home invasion where one was shot

image.altText: A landscape of green grass with chickens roaming free and gumtrees in the background. A farmer walks among the chickens

props.synopsis: When Blythe Calnan and her partner bought their WA farm, they had a clear picture of how they wanted to manage it — by working with the environment to help protect it from future extreme weather events.

title.children: The 'no-brainer' farming technique focused on working with, not against, the environment
